description:
I come here at least once a month. I love northern styled pho with the wide noodles. This is the place for that (other than Turtle Tower). That thin noodle stuff you get at other places? I don't tolerate that stuff. I find those noodles to be the kind of noodles that are hard to put into a little spoon because it gets tangled into a little mess AND.. my sriracha just does not taste right with it. 

You see, I have a platonic relationship with my sriracha. We go hand in hand. I give it loving by eating it with my favorite foods, and it supplies me with a hot spicy flavorgasm in my mouth. 

Anyways, Pho #1 has very good Pho Ga. The chicken here is soooooo moist! (Just thinking about it is making me drool) Sriracha + Pho #1 = love

I think we have a winner.
author: Danielle Y.

description: Even though it is listed as "pho", it is not the typical pho you would expect. This is the chicken pho, which means the noodle is a bit different. So don't be surprise if its not what you expect. Flavor of the food is actually not too bad, but I can't give more than 2 stars because the food is SO OILY!!! When the soup got to my table, you see an entire layer of oil, not soup. Yuck! Definitely had better.
author: Sappho C.

description: I really don't understand all the bad reviews for this place. I have to say because of the negative reviews, it took me this many years to try it and I live in the area. The hubs had the chicken pho, the kids had the meatball pho and i had the pork and eggroll vermichelli. All were very tasty! I especially liked my vermicelli, it had alot of garnishes in it, veggies, etc. The pho was very tasty too! The service was fast and friendly, I will definitely come back.
author: Ravenous T.

description:
Finally, a new Pho place that open around my work.  Now, granted this place is only a few days old so I'll give it time for them to improve on the service and the taste....but I am still excited to have more variety of food in this neighborhood.  Their specialty....Pho Ga (chicken pho) and Pho Tai stands out when compared to their 20 or so different types of soup base and noodles.  I tried their Bun Bo Hue since I got there late and the ladies were already having their Pho Ga and made me try something else.  

For their Pho Ga...i'll say it's pretty decent but the broth is a little off, it can use a little bit more seasoning.  As for the Bun Bo Hue, their broth was good. Very filling and very meaty.  I jokingly complained to the owner that it wasnt spicy enough, owner jokingly told me to add more chili sauce, dipshit.  They also have the charbroiled pork with vermicelli and egg rolls that he recommend I try next time I'm there.......yes sir!  The typical vietnamese dessert drinks, grass jelly, three star mix and milkshakes make up the rest of the menu.

Now I know the owner of this place for quite a while.  He was the chef at "the Window" and her sister is running the "little window" pho place off of Noriega.  I know in due time the broth will taste just right and things will definitely taste great......tastes good now...but will taste great soon.   Will most definitely come back here and try their other dishes.  Service was not up to par yet.....most of the waitresses have A.D.D. and are lost most of the time.  Kinda funny to get the bill when we are in the middle of our meal =)  You can really tell the workers there are inexperience with the vietnamese noodle house atmosphere.

*edit* - 9/24/07 - 
Ah...this is more like it!  In less than 2 weeks they have definitely turn the place around.  Service is superbly better and the food tastes good.  Had their Crab Meat in Tomato soup vermicelli and that tasted great.  The crabmeat is full of flavor, soft and meaty......nice nice nice.  Expect me back here more now.
author: Dave L.

description:
Wow, their chicken intestine noodle reminds me of turtle tower's.
The broth was flavorful and the rice noodle tasted fresh.  They do not offer bean sprouts or basil.  Only lime and Jalapeno.  Which was okay with me.  I guess it's more northern Vietnamese style pho.  The waiter was nice and patience since our friend was not here before us.   And the service was quick.  
One star off because my friend found 2 fruit flies drowned inside the fish sauce bottle.  My friend didn't make a fuss over it but request the lady to replace it. She apologized, took it away... but never gave her another fish sauce bottle, i ended up walking across the table to grab that bottle for her to use.  
Overall, good noodles for a inexpensive price.  
Be aware of parking around noon time when everyone is out for lunch.  I had to drive in a few blocks for residential parking.
author: Selina L.

description:
After a night of ingesting alcohol, I felt like a nice bowl of pho. I remembered a friend telling me about a place with Pho Ga that's even better than Turtle Tower around San Bruno. noo waaayyyy! Since I was in the area, I immediately called for the 10-20 of the spot.  

The Chicken Pho was similar to Turtle Tower's in terms of being "Northern style", but different in the area of taste. I can tell they probably used the beef noodle soup broth, but that combo worked as it was tasty. The chicken was tender so no complaints there. One thing I should note is that their "ho fun" noodles was on the softer side. Depending on the person, they may or may not like this. All in all, it was a good bowl of pho ga. If you like Turtle Tower's #9, you gotta check this place out!
author: Al W.

description: I came here for a family dinner one night and the overall customer service and food was great. Their price and portion was reasonable. But I came here two days ago to order some food togo. I ordered for 6 orders and this one waitress she was extremely rude and disturbing, I was not ready and she kept rushing me, while I was on the phone asking exactly what my friends wanted, she kept disturbing me with what I wanted. I found that extremely rude because she kept rushing me when I was on the phone, and there wasn't even anyone waiting to order or to be seated. SHE is one of the asian waitress with black framed glasses, kinda skinny, tall extremely rude!!
author: Angela L.

description:
I would definitely say I am a loyal, regular customer here. I truly love every dish that comes out of the Pho #1 Kitchen! My usual is the #7 small, chicken noodle soup with intestines..but if you're not a chicken gut person you can order the #6, chicken noodle soup minus the guts. I strongly reccomend this place! It has thick noodles instead of the usual thin, its northern style pho, i believe. The broth is amazing and the chicken is not dry.

and their crab is awesome!! I hate crab but the aroma of garlic draws me in to this yummy dish.

Service very friendly!

Beware! They dont advertise it but its cash only!!
author: nichol l.

description:
I order from them quite often becasue it's fast and easy. The food is pretty good. The portions are decent but has shrunk in the past year. 
Give it a try!
author: C B.

description:
Pho of the most unappetizing, non-delicious variety.

I don't know where Jenny L saw "vegetarian pho" on the menu. When we asked the server, she clearly indicated that not one thing on the menu was vegetarian nor even remotely so. We asked if they could maybe just serve some vegetables and rice for our vegetarian friend, which she refused to do. Finally, she attempted to describe what kind of vegetables they had, but, unable to express it in English, she disappeared and returned with bok choy in hand. Fine, we said, she'll have the bok choy.

My meat eating friends and i all ordered the bbq pho with beef and pork. The meat was beyond inedible. It was almost completely fat, some of it unidentifiable organs (which alone I would have chalked up to cultural discrepancies). My beef had an iridescent green shade...I decided not to eat any more of it lest it be rancid. We fished white pig's feet from the soups, with the bumpy hair follicles still clearly evident. 

I should have ordered the bok choy. I will not be back.
author: Gabrielle A.

description:
One of the only places in the city that serves a decent Bun Rieu.  Not all vietnamese noodle houses serves this dish, I've had my share of bad imitations at other places, so if you like crab and shrimp in a tangy tomato base soup, this is the place for you.  

Also, since their store front claims great Pho Ga (chicken noodle soup), i encourage you to try that too.  Great broth and delicious chicken pieces.  I always ask for a side dish of ginger and scallion so I can enjoy it the chinese way.

If you still have room after your entree, try out their pancake, it's topped with tons of shrimp and pork and fried just to the right crispy-ness.

Nothing like a good bowl of noodle soup for those cold cold windy nights in SF!!!
author: Ames K.

description: The place is well lit, but a bit dingy as far as cleanliness for a restaurant.  Close to home and pretty good pho ga for those cold foggy san francisco nights.  Service is hit or miss.
author: judy l.

description:
I ask the lady.."Do you have bean sprouts and peppers for my soup"

She goes.."Thats not are Style!!!"

I was thinking damm..That was Strong!
author: Eko A.

description: This pho was edible. I wouldn't say horrible, but the meat was not good and what the heck was in the lemonade. It tasted like lemon cough syrup if that even existed. And it was weird because when we went, all the people here had drinks, shakes, lemonade, iced coffee, tea. I would NOT order a drink if I were you, I couldn't even drink mine, but I am generally not trying to antagonize servers/cooks and did not want to send it back or ask for a refund for $1.50. I wouldn't come here again.
author: Lily G.

description: This place was freakin disgusting! Hecka peed off cuz I ordered Bun Bo Hua over the phone. I should have went in. How the heck is there a small fruit fly in my soup? and the couple bites I did take before I seen the nasty bug it tasted like my meat was rancid. Totally ended up eating my boyfriends tacos! The people working at this place were Chinese.. I'm not at all discriminating, but if your Chinese and your cooking "VIETNAMESE" food.. at least  learn the culture and the dish! I regretted not going to CaliPhoNia down the block. Never again.
author: Priscilla B.

description:
The food here is very tasty! My sister was driving us to our dance class at the Metronome and she got lost (again) so we decided to pull over and get dinner first. I didn't have any expectations since there were only 2 other pple when we sat down to order. Pay $6.95 for the large pho and they bring you a bowl that's about the size of a small sink. I honestly think that this was the biggest bowl of pho I've ever eaten. I didn't know that there were different styles of pho (silly, uneducated me) and after some research, I now know that this restaurant serves a more Northern style of pho. This is an interesting article about the history of pho, for those interested. 

http://www.wright.edu/~tran.dung/pho.htm

I got really curious and excited when I saw snail noodle soup on the menu so I ordered it while my sister satisfied her craving for chicken pho. My snail soup came in a tomato broth, had veggies and was surprisingly un-fishy. I never know what I'm gonna get when I randomly order things on a menu in a place that I've never been but I was pretty happy with what I got. Both soups had a flavorful broth and didn't simply taste like msg water. The table next to us got a really interesting appetizer dish of sliced meats, lettuce and spring rolls that we're gonna try next time. The only complaint I have is that the restaurant was freeeeeeezing; it was colder inside than it was out! I guess it doesn't matter once you get your soup but it would've been nice to be able to take my jacket off while I ate...
author: Queenie C.

description:
After a fun day of shooting in a windy day, Pho fix is what I need.  So we decided to try this place since it was close to our fellow shooter's home and we can conveniently drop him off home afterward.  What was ordered:

Spring Roll filled with shrimp and pork - well wrapped but no flavor, worst than bland.  How is that even possible, I have no idea.  I suppose they assume you can drink the accompanied peanut hoisin sauce, which was watered down, you can't even taste the sauce.  

Fried Chicken - another bland dish.  All this dish was, was just the name.  No seasoning or anything.  Fried right and not greasy, but blah.  

Curry Chicken with Bread - the flavor of the curry sauce was actually nice, but the chicken and bread Not.  I can tell that the chicken meat tasted weird and not quality grade.

Bun Ouc/Sea Snail Rice Noodle Soup - You don't get this dish in most Vietnamese restaurant, so I just have to have it.  It was nicely prepared with generous amount of sea snails but lacking the fragrant herb and spice flavors as far as authenticity.    They also used canned tomatoes, which was not as good as fresh tomatoes.  It was overall okay.

Service sucks they brought out the appetizers 20 minutes after the entrees came out.  The entrees were 10 minutes apart from one another.  As you may imagine, not fun watching someone else eat first and half finish before yours arrive or have their food get cold, if they so choose to wait to eat with you.  This kind of poor service really ruined the restaurant experience  of enjoying food together.  Ugh.

They have potential to make it better and if they are smart, they should jump on that since there are plenty of competing restaurants on the same strip.
author: Vanna S.

description: The chicken noodle soup is delicious. The chicken is smooth and tender . The noodles were nice and slippery ... very yummy !! I also had a side order of rare steak which was very good .... the quality of the meat is good and the meat is not too thin or thick . I've had the bun rieu in the past and it did not impress me . Their soy milk tastes kind of weird . It's not sweet at all and does not taste very fresh . Just come for the chicken noodle soup. Skip everything else.
author: Eileen L.

description: I like the Pho Ga (Chicken Noodle Soup) here. It's actually better than a lot of places. But definitely not better than Turtle Tower. The place is decent, but it's very dirty. The chopsticks and plates look disgusting. After seeing those stuff I never wanna go back there again.
author: cadence p.

description:
I'm quite obsessed with their seafood pho because they have bits of fried onions in the soup.  I know it's super weird because it overpowers the seafood taste, but i really dig that fried onion taste in my soup, lol.  

The small is quite large in my opinion, and every time I finish the whole thing, I look as if im pregnant, lol.  

Try to avoid sitting in the back because they have this blender that's as loud as a jackhammer.  It gets really annoying after a while.  And it gets super annoying when people keep ordering drinks that requires that stinking machine.  

Of course there's better pho elsewhere, but I'm hooked on that fried onion stuff in my seafood pho.  -_-
author: Emily L.

description:
The best chicken pho! I live close to this restuarant so I usually just call them and order my chicken pho to go. It is ready within 10 minutes, so i will just drive down there and call them to help me bring the food outside. They are actually really nice to do so. 

Parking sometimes is hard, especially during lunch hours.
author: Willa L.

description:
My recommendations are:

Crab meat rice noodles in tomato soup - because I have never seen such big chunks of crab meat, soup is HOT, and good for a chilly afternoon.

Chicken salad with sesame - I just can't stop eating when it's on the table.

Coconut drink with red beans - thirst-beat iced drinks which I hardly finished up as I was stuffed with noodles.

They have some crab special on menu, will report after trial!
author: Woodspy T.

description:
The GayZ visited this restaurant on a Thursday night with his husbear and immediately noticed that they did not have goi cuon (spring rolls) on the menu. "No problem," I thought. "They must have just forgotten to put it on the menu. I'll ask."  When I did, I got a blank stare and had to repeat myself. The waitress who must have been the owner's wife said that they didn't have them. 

"That's fine," I thought. "Deny me my spring rolls. I'll just try something else!" So I did. I ordered a large seafood pho and a chicken salad to share. Husbear had the large beef pho. The chicken salad came first and was excellent - shredded thin and piled high with cabbage, carrots, mint, crushed peanuts and really fresh tasting chicken with crispy garlic on top. Mmmm mmm. 

Then came the pho - without bean sprouts or herbs. Just limes and jalepenos. Husbear asked for sprouts and the lady just said "Um, this is a Vietnamese restaurant. We don't have bean sprouts. I have basil. I bring you that." When she left both me and cubby were like, "Ooohhh ahn ahhh!!!" (general sound of disbelief) I could not believe the bitch said "this is a Vietnamese restaurant." Bitch, I could have told you that!! How you gonna tell me that this is a Vietnamese restaurant and then tell me you don't have goi cuon or bean sprouts?? Whatever. They had Teresa Tang playing on the stereo when we came in, this place is Chinese!!!

Anyway, the pho was alright at best. Both soups had good flavor, but the wide rice noodles were WAY over cooked, to the point that they were just falling apart and gloppy. What's more, all of my seafood was overcooked, everything from the unseasoned squid to the shrimp and the imitation crab. Just about the only seafood that was good was the fish cake. 

I might go back to try the Bun Cha (vermicelli bowl) or have the salad again, but this is definitely not the place for pho. I'll stick with Them Ky in the Trenderloin for that. 

three stars for english speaking waitress and one star for yummy chicken salad, but minus one star for overcooked noodles and no goi cuon.
author: Jeff K.

description: I went to this restaurant for some pho yesterday with my friend and ordered the beef stew. And let me tell you, it was delicious. Although, it took a while to get the food, and the service was decent. It was really busy and the workers were nice. I give this restaurant Okay.
author: Sandy C.

description:
I placed the order over the phone and the lady who answered had a hard time understanding what I said. Then I picked up the food and everything is good. The taste is good. It's better than the pho place on noreiga but not as good as Turtle Tower. The soup taste is really good but the chicken is so so. Overall, me and my gf both love it. We will be eating there more. 

Suggestion: I will take some pics next time when I eat there. We need pic of the menu if anybody can post up.
author: Win S.

description:
I'm glad that we now have a Pho place in Portola. Silver Garden wasn't great anyways. It was just cheap. 

This place does not have the BEST pho. It's just a decent. I guess you only know what's suppose to compliment with Pho if you are Vietnamese or a Pho fan. This place has does not have herbs (mint or basil) to accompany with the noodle soup (Pho, Bun Rieu, Bun Bo Hue). 

I have not try their Pho, but according to my family it is only OKAY. I have tried their Bun Bo Hue. It is actually the only thing that I ate there. Their Bun Bo Hue is also okay. No basil complimentary, just shredded cabbage, and bean sprout?. We asked for them and their excuse was that they're from the North. Northern Pho does not come with herbs. SURE! Herbs are expensive, that's why you don't give them. That's more reasonable. 

They're not 100% Vietnamese. They're Chinese in Vietnam or half Chinese something like that. Don't get me wrong. I'm half Vietnamese and Chinese. My point is don't expect too much authenticity when Chinese cooks Vietnamese food or Chinese cooking Japanese food. Yes, there are ones that have done quite a good job, but I feel more comfortable when they cook their own ethnic food.
author: MT D.

description:
Windy, cold, and hungry. Again we were at an intersection for chinese or vietnamese. Exited 101S, and here we are. Pho #1. We did go to Yummy Bowl, but they were closed and told us to go down a block to Pho #1.
With that, we had vietnamese for dinner.
4 stars -good location, easy parking, cheap eats
3 stars- no banh mi sandwiches!
3 stars- clean ladies room which is important cause it reflects the staff there
3 stars- open late

Will return in the future!
author: Mauling W.

description: Whenever I don't get tempted by the thought of roast pork at Wing Sing across the street, I come here for pho and the warm soup. I particularly like the conch noodle soup. My taste buds love the tomato broth soup it comes in.
author: H K.

description: Not bad for some pho or bun Bo hue if you consider that it is more Chinese orientated than Vietnamese but if you want a clean nice service restaurant with decent pho I suggest this place as Id like to say I'm a regular here. But beware if you want the "Vietnamese noodles" or rice noodles here you needa ask for them as their noodle soups comes with egg noodles
author: Aaron L.

description: Two words:  too salty.  Broth in my pho was too salty, but the waitress has a nice bum, I'll give her that.  Sorry for the sexist comment, but this is the last time I'm coming here, that's for sure.
author: James C.

description: Their chicken Pho is the best I've tasted, they have a few other descent dishes, but nothing special. Their drinks are below average. If you want chicken pho, go here.
author: Killua Z.

description: What kind of Vietnamese restaurant doesn't have basil?  A fake one.  And they don't even have vermicelli in their pho?  What?!  Disgrace to Vietnamese cuisine.  Bleh.  And to make things worse.  Terrible service and Cash only.  Do yourself a favor, don't come here.
author: David N.

description: Service is as shi**y as the look on the waitress' face. I see why she's only a waitress.  Which one, you may ask? The one that never smiles and pretends not to see you when you walk in or when you need the check. I still eat here because the pho is different and DECENT at best.
author: D. C.

description:
Been here twice. Once for chicken pho and another for the beef pho with everything.
Chicken pho was pretty good, I'd get it again. Oily but not too greasy. Garlicy but not too potent. Juicy chicken. I like.
Beef pho, not so much. had better elsewhere. I don't think they change the broth... gross...
Service sucks. They also need to get that door fixed so that it closes when you want! The wind keeps blowing the door open and its been freakin cold!
author: Jimmy N.

description:
Worth the trip out to a part of town that you've probably never been to for this truly authentic spot.  Service was very friendly and considerate.  We came with one veggie in the group.  They were very accommodating to her needs.  I must note that there were no vegetarian items on the menu except the spring rolls and an excellent dessert and drink menu. 

Make sure to order the papaya salad (w/o fish sauce for the veggie) and the spring rolls were slammin.  The Pho was a bit too authentic for much of our group's taste.  I ordered the Spicy Beef and Pork Pho.  The broth was delicious but I was a bit taken by the choice of Pork parts that was selected.  I'll spare you most the details, but mention that I've  never before played with pig hoof.  Had a good laugh convincing our  friend his beef ball soup was a different kind of ball than it was.

All in all a good spot and the prices were right. A bit more description  on the menu would have been helpful.  The fourth star is mostly for making us come to a part of town we've never been to.
author: Chris M.

description: This is not your traditional pho place...the noodles are thicker you get shredded cabbage instead of bean sprouts for the soup. The soup was pretty good but I've had better...service wasn't all that great either. Lastly, it is CASH ONLY! I hate that because I never seem to have cash on me when I need it...haha I don't think I would come back here again unless I happen to be in the area.
author: Karen Y.

description:
Bring a big jacket when you come here. I swear I got up like 5 times to close their stupid brokenass door.  So cold... :(

The service is WEAK!.. It took longer to get the check and pay than to eat the f'n Pho. We were a minute away from dashing. haha lol..  when the waiter came flying out the back like Usain Bolt when we got up to leave. Probably to check the cash. -__-. Where the f were you before??

The Pho: is not even Pho. The noodles. WTF. It was some thick rice noodle. :( No bean sprouts, mint leaves? I asked her why.. she said this place is not Vietnamese. bahaha. The soup base was good though. :)

Their Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk was :D.  Too bad it was such a small portion.

Is this place Pho real?
author: Simon S.

description: Never understood places that only serve Grilled Pork Chop- Grilled Pork (slices) is SOOOO much better!  And the grilled pork over here is SUPER good!  The slices are tender and packed with flavor, goes perfectly with their fish sauce.  The ladies are nice and attentive.  Nice addition to the neighborhood!
author: Judy K.

description: Vegetarian pho in beef broth.  Sounds like an oxymoron but it definitely cures the worst of hangovers.  Not the best service, but that is expected.  Hopefully won't have to go back again due to hangovers.
author: Jenny L.

description: Yummy cheap food. The garlic noodles are ridonkulous.
author: Pamela W.

description: I am just a white girl who loves ethnic food. I have no idea of the authenticity level of the food they serve at Pho# 1. All I can say, is the grilled barbecue beef with noodles, #30 on the menu, is so good! It is such a nice alternative to fast food. For under $7.00, you get delicious barbecue beef over noodles, with fresh mint, bean sprouts and cucumbers. The meat is so good, with no fat, that is the best part. The food is fresh and tasty, not greasy. I would love to see a little more meat on my plate, this is why the 4 star rating. Other than that, this place is delicious. I order it to go, as the restaurant is not the most cozy. I would rather curl up at my house to enjoy.
author: Keri V.

description: this is absolutely  the worse Vietnamese restaurant i have ever eat , i order an pho .. first its bit over price.. second the soup is fill with msg, i am drink like gold fish after eating the meal .. third , they don't serve basil nor bean sprout with pho ,, when i ask the waitress they said they never serve basil for pho..however she did bring out an small portion of bean sprout.. can you imagine eating pho with out basil.. its like eating burger without beef patty .. also the noodle are not the right thin traditional Vietnam noodle ,,its thick ho fan noodle.. on top of that ,, the service is very poor..  no wonder this place have no business.. they deserve what they  got .. if there is negative 5 star , this place would have win it easily...
author: sunny s.

description: each time i come here for pho, they serve the round or the chinese flat noodles. didn't even give bean sprouts. cheapskates!
author: J K.

description: My pho place to go to when I'm in the Portola. The service is attentive and friendly. The place is bright, spacious and clean. The bowls of pho are big and prices cheap. I usually cheat and get the chicken pho-delicious on a cold afternoon.
author: Jenny W.

description: This place specializes in chicken pho and is a little different from the usual pho place.  First of all, if you are a bean sprout fan just like I am, you might not like it here because they claim they are some regional vietnamese food that bean sprouts and the usual herbs are not suppose to be eaten with the noodles.  The kind of noodles they use are also different.  It is softer and wider.  Some might like it but I prefer the regular pho noodles that has a chew to it.  The broth actually tasted good and was flavorful.
author: Heidi F.

description: I feel like I'm one of the few white people who live in portola... and most places around here I'm a little intimidated to go to.  But the vermicelli noodles with bbq pork are so delicious I will face my fears and order from them.  A friend of mine made the mistake of straying from the noodle dishes... not such a good idea.
author: Amanda D.

description: I have to update my previous review...my 2nd visit I had #14 Beef pho with thin rice noodles instead of the wide flat noodles.  Though the noodles are not the same as most southern Pho, the soup was good.  The broth was flavorful and not greasy.  The beef was tender but I only got 2 beef balls.  I will definitely return for the quail or claypot.  There are no decent Pho places south of the Tenderloin and this place is almost as good.  Place is clean and staff is friendly. Plus they serve beer.  Cash only
author: May M.

description: i love this place, even though they don't serve real pho noodles, i still adore this place very much. i haven't ordered anything to deal with lettuce here since i've read many other reviews about bugs on them. the only thing that i mainly order from here is their chicken noodle soup, it is amazingly good! i haven't found any chicken noodle soup that is as good as the ones from turtle tower. even though the service here is a little bit slow, their chicken noodle soup makes everything all better haha.
author: Yummy T.

description: Two large bowls of number 15 for me and my babe please!! For those of you who dont know what I'm talking about, its crab meat in tomato sauce with rice noodles. YUMMY!! Too hot for a hot bowl of noodle soup?? No problem, try number 30!! Vermicelli with BBQ beef with fresh veggies. Me and my husband always finds a way to eat here regardless of the weather. One problem though, I must fight with every other asian person trying to get parking on San Bruno Avenue. If you live around this area, best to walk or take the bus.
author: Anonymous P.

description: It's a different type of Pho, which I'm not commonly eaten. It's Pho Bac, which they called it and the noodles are thicker and thin. The Soup base is extremely SALTY. I can literally drink an full cup water afterward and still have that MSG sting in the back of my throat. If the Pho isn't so salty, then my meal would taste great. I can still smell the nice aroma of the seasonings in my mouth, but SALTINESS has to GO. People are intake lower sodium these days, and this isn't a great place for Low Sodium diet person, nor regular person's diet
author: n a.

description: I kept hearing good things about this place but when I ordered, the broth smelled like rancid oil, it was very off putting.  I definitely will not go back there.
author: Danielle B.

description:
Is good food and very clean and the waitress  very serve very nice.
i will go back there.
author: Bob L.

description: i've came here once and the food wasn't even good nor is their customer services about coming to your table to refill your tea. the soup was way too oily. hello, am i suppose to drink oil or actual soup? the only reason why i'd came here was because they opened recently and since i live nearby, but i'd rather drive elsewhere if i knew this place was like that.
author: Valerie N.

description: Excellent Vietnamese food at a low cost. Food arrived in a reasonable amount of time.
author: Mark E.

description: Not the most original name for a Pho restaurant but they are named aptly. Their Pho with flank and meatball is really good; served with ho fun (wide rice noodles) noddles & tasty broth, $6.95 for large. Service was a bit off, the waitress forgot the lime and peppers and our drinks..the place is clean and new looking. Good grub, good prices, definitely coming back soon..
author: Steve K.

description: hey hey! not bad! i was mad because my mom had not brought me here earlier. the spring rolls were pretty goood. (but i dont really like fried stuff). and their chicken noodle soup was good. i wasnt too into the beef.. but yeah the place was pretty comfortable. i approve!
author: Judy L.

description: this place is digusting, does not at all taste like authentic pho. the noodles they gave were the wide noodles and you CAN'T choose your noodles. AND they gave a poor amount of noodles so HELL NO I dont recommend people to eat here. There are two other pho restaurants on San Bruno first is yummy bowl and this other one next to the gas station next to silver ave, that new place is pretty good.
author: tammy w.

description:
good, solid soup!

usual not very friendly service to match better than good pho.

had the chicken soup which comes with flat noodles.  

great company too!
author: Henry F.

description: we ordered the shaking beef and it was so chewy that it was inedible, when we tried to send it back....they refused! some of the other food was good but we were really put off by their flat out refusal to take the dish back, and they let it sit on our table untouched for the rest of the meal.
author: warren a.

description: i've had pho before, and liked it, even though i'm not a soup person. i did not like the pho here. j and i got the mango fruit drink, and b got the strawberry one. those were good, sweet, but good. very fruity and just $2.50 i think. we passed on the apps cuz they were small and as much as the pho. ben had the beef with beef balls soup. his came with thin flat noodles and lime and jalapenos and looked pretty good. j and i both chose the spicy beef and pork pho. these came with the jalapeno, lime, and also lettuce. we all got larges which were about $8 i think. i didnt like my soup, and neither did j. one, hardly any noodles, and what were there were soggy fat white things. there were about 2 pieces of beef. 2 small pieces. then it had lots of squares of blood clots, and then 2 or 3 pigs feet. i've had pho before and liked it. this was not enjoyable. i googled pics of spicy beef and pork pho and it comes up with tasty looking soups. then google blood clot pigs feet soup and it comes up with what we ate. or sat in front of. i think they switched it. ok so even if i liked those things, it was too brothy and not noodly enough. i shoulda had the chicken. j and i picked at our soup then the 3 of us left and we went down the st to ling lings and picked up some chinese food for much cheaper that was much tastier. so moral of the story is, go here if you dont mind soggy noodles and you dont mind not getting what it says on the menu. but its not a horrible place. the service was good enough. ps cash only. Dinner for 3 came out to $30 something.
author: Merredith L.

description: i like this place cus they have bun rieu. most pho restaurants dont have this. i alsooo loove their three color drink. i only have problems when i came here with my boyfriend and we were sitting there WAITING for help... while the waitresses are wandering around doing nothing... the these chinese people come walking in and they served them first.
author: A A.
